intro: Schistocarpha croatii, commonly known as the Croatian rock everlasting, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white to pale pink ray florets. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Schistocarpha croatii is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is a valuable species for ecological restoration in arid and semi-arid areas.
